meanings.definition: Mambos (verb): to dance in a lively and rhythmic manner
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone mambos to the music.
meanings.sent2: She mambos gracefully on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The little penguin tried to mambos but kept slipping on the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her heart mambos to the beat of the drums.
meanings.sent5: The children mambos joyfully under the stars.

meanings.definition: Mambos (noun): a style of dance music popular in the 1940s and 1950s
meanings.sent1: The band played lively mambos all night long.
meanings.sent2: People loved to dance to the upbeat mambos.
meanings.sent3: Grandma surprised us all by playing mambos on the piano.
meanings.sent4: The mambos filled the room with infectious energy.
meanings.sent5: The radio station played classic mambos every Saturday.

meanings.definition: Mambos (adjective): relating to or characteristic of the dance style or music known as mambo
meanings.sent1: The energetic mambos beat got everyone moving.
meanings.sent2: She wore a vibrant, mambos-inspired dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics had a mambos flair to them.
meanings.sent4: The city streets pulsed with a mambos rhythm.
meanings.sent5: His mambos spirit shone through in his lively performance.
